sections.content: At CompoundLive, I transitioned from pure engineering to solutions engineering‚Äîworking directly with C-suite healthcare teams to implement our telehealth platform. This role taught me that technical excellence means nothing if you can't translate it into business value.

sections.title: The Challenge
sections.content: CompoundLive's 5-month deployment cycles were killing deal velocity. Each client required custom implementation work, creating bottlenecks and inconsistent experiences. I needed to find a way to standardize without sacrificing flexibility.
I identified patterns across 6+ healthcare teams and built reusable implementation frameworks:

content: Standardized onboarding processes reducing custom work
Modular configuration templates for common use cases
Documentation and training materials for self-service setup
Automated deployment scripts eliminating manual steps
‚è±Ô∏è Deployment Time: Cut from 5 months to 5 weeks (80% reduction)

sections.content: The fastest way to ship isn't more features‚Äîit's better processes. Reusable frameworks beat custom solutions every time.
